medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had chronic depression since college but became depressed after his mother's death five years prior to admission. Symptoms included mild psychomotor retardation and predominant right-hand tremor developing months later. Symptoms worsened over four years with increasing depression and parkinsonian symptoms. He was evaluated due to exacerbation of his conditions four months before admission, which included increased depression with early morning awakening.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of chronic depression and Parkinson's disease symptoms. Treated unsuccessfully with various antidepressants, anticholinergics, and dopaminergic therapy.
